text: Doğan Akhanlı (; 18 March 1957 – 31 October 2021) was a Turkish-born German writer. His works focused on genocides of the 20th century, such as those affecting Armenians and the Jews. His works criticized Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and often got him arrested. Akhanlı died from cancer on 31 October 2021 at the age of 64 in Berlin. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2021 deaths Category:German novelists Category:German essayists Category:German political writers Category:Turkish novelists Category:Turkish essayists Category:Turkish political writers
